poem:
Title: "At the Turn of a Child's Laughter"
  
There, within the cradle of the untold,
Lies £2,800 in elusive currency,
The echo of a child's mirth held in captivity,
By a digital giggle-jailer, unmoved by pleas or fury.
A monetary manifesto of invisible labor,
Once traded for the whispers of tiny hands,
Now held in the grid of remoteness,
Its promise, an unwelcome joke, laughingly sour.
